wiki.summary: "Plan B" is a powerful anthem that highlights independence, self-worth and the rejection of toxic relationships. The song serves as a message to a former lover, expressing the narrator's disbelief that she was once involved with someone so unworthy. In the first verse, Megan addresses her ex, emphasizing her decision to take Plan B to avoid being stuck with him. She acknowledges that he still surrounds himself with questionable women and asserts that she is the only reason he had any attention in the first place. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Plan B" is a powerful anthem that highlights independence, self-worth and the rejection of toxic relationships. The song serves as a message to a former lover, expressing the narrator's disbelief that she was once involved with someone so unworthy. In the first verse, Megan addresses her ex, emphasizing her decision to take Plan B to avoid being stuck with him. She acknowledges that he still surrounds himself with questionable women and asserts that she is the only reason he had any attention in the first place. Despite this, she remains confident and unbothered, stating that she never relied on him and is determined to maintain her independence. Megan refuses to let any man define her worth. The chorus encourages women to love and value themselves, reminding them that they have the power to walk away from toxic situations. Megan asserts that her self-worth is not tied to a man's presence or actions, and she urges women to prioritize their own well-being and pursuit of money. In the second verse, Megan reflects on the material success she has achieved, highlighting her luxurious lifestyle and financial independence. She mocks her ex's laziness and entitlement, questioning how he could want a successful woman without putting in the necessary effort himself. Megan regrets not trusting her instincts and ignoring the warning signs, vowing to never make the same mistake again. She exposes her ex's shortcomings, proclaiming that the only thing he can boast about is having slept with her. Megan asserts her power and makes it clear that she won't tolerate his disrespect any longer. Overall, "Plan B" serves as a declaration of strength, resilience, and self-love. It encourages women to prioritize themselves and not let toxic relationships define them. The song celebrates independence and sends a powerful message that no one should compromise their worth for someone who doesn't appreciate or deserve them. Read more on Last.fm.
